sen.e: Yakushiji Kichijoten zo is a portrait of Kisshoten (Laksmi) from the Nara period (ad 710–784) and is a possession of the Yakushi-ji Temple in Nara prefecture.

sen.e: The statue of Kichijoten zo with both hands rose to chest height, held the nyoi hoju (a sacred jewel, said to remove suffering, capable of granting every wish) in the left hand, expressed by turning to the right.

sen.j: 本作品は吉祥悔過会（きちじょうけかえ）の本尊像として製作されたものと推定される。
sen.e: It is estimated that this work was produced as a statue for the principal image of Kichijokekae (reverence for devotional meetings).

sen.j: 吉祥悔過会とは奈良時代に始まったもので、年の初めに宮中や諸大寺において吉祥天像を祀る。
sen.e: Kichijokekae started in Nara period, and it was a ceremony held at the imperial court and major temples at the beginning of the year to dedicate the Statue of Kisshoten.
